metadata.title: CVE-2019-7308 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium
metadata.description:
kernel/bpf/verifier.c in the Linux kernel before 4.20.6 performsundesirable out-of-bounds speculation on pointer arithmetic in variouscases, including cases of different branches with different state or limitsto sanitize, leading to side-channel attacks.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-7308` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-5.19.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic - 5.19.0-21.21
linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-21-generic-64k - 5.19.0-21.21
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1009-aws - 5.19.0-1009.9
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-gcp - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-kvm - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.19.0-1008-oracle - 5.19.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi - 5.19.0-1004.10
linux-image-5.19.0-1004-raspi-nolpae - 5.19.0-1004.10
No subscription required

linux-image-5.19.0-1003-starfive - 5.19.0-1003.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-21.21').
linux-aws package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1009.9').
linux-azure package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1008.8').
linux-gcp package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1008.8').
linux-kvm package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1008.8').
linux-oracle package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1008.8').
linux-raspi package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1004.10').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of kernel support, was needs-triage').
linux-starfive package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.19.0-1003.4').
